author: m.kalinin
content: It would make sense to add `RANDOM` opcode since migration to Eth1 Shard is done. The value returned by `RANDOM` should be derived from randao seed.

author: m.kalinin
content:
> wdym 'stay inside' eth1 block? does the eth1-engine have some notion of block/timestamp independent of the eth2-client?
Our intention was to keep eth1-engine execution part as close to eth1 client as possible. Therefore, block number and timestamp are gonna be part of Eth1 block after the merge point. Block number sequence is gonna be preserved while timestamp could either be passed to `eth2_produceBlock` or current time can still be used (it will have a slight shift from the beginning of the slot)

author: gballet
content:
> <@!353136597522448385> one argument against is that it's not as intuitive a definition for applications that try to use it down the road and is bound to lead to confusion (relative to difficulty = 0, which qualitatively makes sense)
<@!345680403052625930> down the road, it  should not be available at all, instead of returning any constant value. What I'm suggesting is effectively to reuse the opcode for `DICCFICULTY` and indeed rename it `RANDOM`, so as not to break the few applications that do use it.
